title: Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink (*check this*)
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. A variation of the scheme of -1532 and of -1551, representing a coffered vault. Women are seated beside urns below. A mask between figures is shown on top of teh pointed arch. In the center is a view at an entablature and a balustrade.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink (*check this*). Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1562.
